Package com.jme.asset.cache

Interface AssetCache

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SimpleAssetCache, WeakRefAssetCache, WeakRefCloneAssetCache
    public interface AssetCache
    AssetCache is an interface for asset caches. Allowing storage of loaded resources in order to improve their access time if they are requested again in a short period of time. Depending on the asset type and how it is used, a specialized caching method can be selected that is most appropriate for that asset type. The asset cache must be thread safe.

    Some caches are used to manage cloneable assets, which track reachability based on a shared key in all instances exposed in user code. E.g. WeakRefCloneAssetCache uses this approach. For those particular caches, either registerAssetClone(com.jme.asset.AssetKey, java.lang.Object) or notifyNoAssetClone() MUST be called to avoid memory leaking following a successful addToCache(com.jme.asset.AssetKey, java.lang.Object) or getFromCache(com.jme.asset.AssetKey) call!

    Author:
    Kirill Vainer

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      <T> void addToCache​(AssetKey<T> key, T obj)
      Adds an asset to the cache.
      void clearCache()
      Deletes all assets from the cache.
      boolean deleteFromCache​(AssetKey key)
      Deletes an asset from the cache.
      <T> T getFromCache​(AssetKey<T> key)
      Retrieves an asset from the cache.
      void notifyNoAssetClone()
      Notifies the cache that even though the methods addToCache(com.jme.asset.AssetKey, java.lang.Object) or getFromCache(com.jme.asset.AssetKey) were used, there won't be a call to registerAssetClone(com.jme.asset.AssetKey, java.lang.Object) for some reason.
      <T> void registerAssetClone​(AssetKey<T> key, T clone)
      This should be called by the asset manager when it has successfully acquired a cached asset (with getFromCache(com.jme.asset.AssetKey)) and cloned it for use.

    • Method Detail

      • addToCache

        <T> void addToCache​(AssetKey<T> key,
                    T obj)
        Adds an asset to the cache. Once added, it should be possible to retrieve the asset by using the getFromCache(com.jme.asset.AssetKey) method. However the caching criteria may at some point choose that the asset should be removed from the cache to save memory, in that case, getFromCache(com.jme.asset.AssetKey) will return null.

        Thread-Safe

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the asset to cache.
        Parameters:
        key - The asset key that can be used to look up the asset.
        obj - The asset data to cache.

      • registerAssetClone

        <T> void registerAssetClone​(AssetKey<T> key,
                            T clone)
        This should be called by the asset manager when it has successfully acquired a cached asset (with getFromCache(com.jme.asset.AssetKey)) and cloned it for use.

        Thread-Safe

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the asset to register.
        Parameters:
        key - The asset key of the loaded asset (used to retrieve from cache)
        clone - The clone of the asset retrieved from the cache.

      • notifyNoAssetClone

        void notifyNoAssetClone()
        Notifies the cache that even though the methods addToCache(com.jme.asset.AssetKey, java.lang.Object) or getFromCache(com.jme.asset.AssetKey) were used, there won't be a call to registerAssetClone(com.jme.asset.AssetKey, java.lang.Object) for some reason. For example, if an error occurred during loading or if the addToCache/getFromCache were used from user code.

      • getFromCache

        <T> T getFromCache​(AssetKey<T> key)
        Retrieves an asset from the cache. It is possible to add an asset to the cache using addToCache(com.jme.asset.AssetKey, java.lang.Object). The asset may be removed from the cache automatically even if it was added previously, in that case, this method will return null.

        Thread-Safe

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the asset to retrieve
        Parameters:
        key - The key used to lookup the asset.
        Returns:
        The asset that was previously cached, or null if not found.

      • deleteFromCache

        boolean deleteFromCache​(AssetKey key)
        Deletes an asset from the cache.

        Thread-Safe

        Parameters:
        key - The asset key to find the asset to delete.
        Returns:
        True if the asset was successfully found in the cache and removed.

      • clearCache

        void clearCache()
        Deletes all assets from the cache.

        Thread-Safe
